examples: the boat tilted and the boatmen cried out in alarm
some experts view the plan with alarm

verb.description: Cause (someone) to feel frightened, disturbed, or in danger.
examples: the government was alarmed by an outbreak of unrest

verb.description: Be fitted or protected with an alarm.
examples: this door is locked and alarmed between 11 p.m. and 6 a.m.

origin: Late Middle English (as an exclamation meaning to arms!): from Old French alarme, from Italian allarme, from all' arme! to arms!.
